New Records: New Zealand's biggest ever T20 victory over Australia
Devon Conway's 92* is the highest score by a New Zealander in a T20 World Cup match against Australia
Key Match Events: Finn Allen's 42 off 16 balls set the tone for New Zealand's innings
Devon Conway's 92* carried the New Zealand innings
Glenn Phillips took a stunning catch to dismiss Marcus Stoinis
Australia never got going in their chase, with just Glenn Maxwell (28) and Pat Cummins (21) passing 20
Tim Southee finished with figures of 3-6 and Mitch Santner 3-31 from four overs
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Aaron Finch said Australia got the jump on New Zealand with the bat and never recovered
Devon Conway was named player of the match for his 92*
Mitch Santner said it was a tough place to win, but nice to fire some shots early tonight
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's win is their first in any format in Australia since 2011
Australia are back in action on Tuesday against Sri Lanka
This is Australia's heaviest defeat ever at a T20 World Cup
